title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 September 2014 - XWiki

14:00 <vmassol> grrr I failed the build  
14:00 <vmassol> fixing  
14:00 <Denis> has quit  
14:34 <evalica> has quit  
14:39 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
14:51 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
14:55 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:01 <msmeria> has quit  
15:01 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
15:07 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
15:15 <vmassol> pretty happy to have fixed the shutdown issue :)  
15:16 <vmassol> seems to be working well now, I couldn't fault it so far…. crossing fingers  
15:18 <Enygma`> yes, have not seen problems in a while  
15:18 <Enygma`> pretty awesome  
15:19 <Enygma`> this is what we have now as slightly annoying flicker http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/lastBuild/testReport/  
15:20 <vmassol> strange you didn't see it in a while, I was seeing them all the time locally when hitting ctrl-c  
15:20 <Enygma`> shows up occasionally  
15:20 <Enygma`> ah, wait, you mean the solr stuff?  
15:20 <vmassol> among others yes  
15:20 <Enygma`> yes, I thought you were talking about the XWiki instances not shutting down  
15:21 <vmassol> ah no that was fixed 1 or 2 days ago indeed :)  
15:21 <Enygma`> looking at the commit. If we fixed the solr stuff maybe jenkins will run smoother too  
15:21 <Enygma`> cool!  
15:21 <vmassol> yes  
15:22 <vmassol> and smaller jenkins logs  
15:22 <Enygma`> yep, awesome. Looking forward to profit from this improvement :)  
15:22 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
15:27 <Enygma`> on the tests side, we still have:  
15:27 <Enygma`> - 1 wysiwyg test that has an issue created for it http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11057 ,  
15:27 <Enygma`> - a problem (Unknown connection issue!) with xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping that shows up now and then as observed here: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/74/testReport/junit/xwiki-enterprise-ui-mainwiki-all-6.3-SNAPSHOT/xar/ArchiveSuite/  
15:29 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
15:31 <OSIMasson> has left #xwiki  
15:31 <vmassol> tmortagne: why did you change the instructions? The UI says "promote" on nexus. I don't see any "validate" button  
15:31 <vmassol> there's a "Release" one though  
15:32 <vmassol> who could work on XWIKI-11057?  
15:32 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:32 <vmassol> would be good to have for 6.2.1  
15:32 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: when are you planning to fix webstandards btw ? :)  
15:32 <tmortagne> vmassol: that's because on nexus you should not use the promote button so talking about promote in the documentation was not making this veru obvious..  
15:32 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: 6.3  
15:33 <tmortagne> it's close, then release, not promote  
15:33 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: be careful not to push it to the last moment though  
15:33 <vmassol> 6.3M1 would be good  
15:33 <vmassol> but I don' tknow the full list of other issues you have on your plate  
15:37 <gdelhumeau> about http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui-6.2.x/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.invitation/InvitationTest/testDeclineInvitation/  
15:38 <gdelhumeau> the issue is that the guest user is redirected to the login form  
15:38 <gdelhumeau> instead of seing the desired page  
15:40 <gdelhumeau> it sounds quite normal since there is a right object on the page, that sets "view" for "AllGroup"  
15:40 <vmassol> you mean we've fixed some permission bug?  
15:41 <Enygma`> yes, those invitation tests are fixed from the POV of my javascript PO modifications. Now they seem to be having some problems with the code itself. Need to reproduce locally first to say more.  
15:43 <andreeapopescu> has left #xwiki  
15:51 <gdelhumeau> now the question is: why there is a right object there  
15:52 <gdelhumeau> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-invitation/xwiki-platform-invitation-ui/src/main/resources/Invitation/InvitationMemberActions.xml#L116  
16:00 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
16:03 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: I think I got it  
16:04 <Enygma`> at a first glance, looks like I missed some fixes in my refactoring  
16:04 <Enygma`> testing locally  
16:05 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki  
16:13 <Enygma`> ok, 1 more UI test left.

18:57 <vmassol> I love the documentation of the XWikiLink class....  
18:58 <vmassol> and the variables are so well named....  
19:02 <tmortagne> :)  
19:07 <helge> has joined #xwiki  
19:08 <lucaa1> has quit  
19:09 <helge> Hi, buttons with drop-down lists in Flamingo skin do not work for normal users, only for admins. Do I have to change rights at some place? Upgraded XWiki 6.2 from 6.0.1  
19:16 <vmassol> helge: wdym by "not work"?  
19:16 <vmassol> make sure you refresh your cache too  
19:17 <vmassol> no rights change  
19:17 <vmassol> are you talking about the top level menu for example?  
19:21 <helge> eg the drop-down next to the user name. You need to go there to access the logout button. But as a normal user the drop-down won't drop down, as admin it does.  
19:21 <helge> I always refresh the cache  
19:22 <helge> So actually I can not log out if I am a normal user. Same with all the drop-down menues  
19:29 <Slashman> has quit  
19:30 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
19:35 <polx> has quit  
19:39 <helge> vmassol: fixed it by playing around with global rights.
